Row.Text: Snipers for support - highly trained marksmen - operate, almost independantly, in a pair or sometimes a sniper team; their aim to maintain close visual contact with the enemy and engage targets from concealed places. The term Sniper originated in British India- it meant a hunter skilled enough to kill the snipe, a wading bird with camouflage which may cause them to be undetected by hunters in marshland. Snipers are trained in Marksmanship, but also in camouflage, field craft, infiltration, special reconnaissance, target acquisition and surveillance.
A Industrial Era Unit designed for hit-and-run attacks.
Use it for recon, the Sniper has 1 moves, and also can move after attacking. This means it can perform hit-and-run attacks; attack, and move out. Its strong in ranged.
